Docs.summary: Defines the metadata attribute that ASP.NET server controls use to specify whether they participate in loading view-state information by . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is used to specify a control that requires view-state loading by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A>. The default view-state loading behavior is for ASP.NET to load the view-state information for a control by its index in the control tree of the page. There is a performance cost for loading view-state information by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> because the page control tree must be searched for the control specifically before loading its view-state information.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is used as a metadata attribute of a custom control class,
the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewStateByID%2A> property of the control returns `true`. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class is not used, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewStateByID%2A> property of the control returns its default value of `false`, which means that the control does not load its view-state information by <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A>.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/docs/standard/attributes/index.md).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class does not apply to saving the view-state information for a control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateModeByIdAttribute> class metadata attribute is valid only on class declarations.
